questionListItems.title: In secondary school, how many training sessions are there per week and how long is each session?

answer.body:
School Team Sports CCAs have 3 training sessions per week. Generally, training sessions are held on Monday, Wednesday and Friday. Each training session can be up to 3 hours long, from 3pm to 6pm.


Performing Arts CCAs are held on Monday, Wednesday and Friday. More practices are arranged only when there is a need to prepare for nation-wide events (e.g. SYF Arts Presentation) or a performance/concert. In such instances, parents and students will be notified at least 2 weeks in advance. Each training session is about 2 to 3 hours long, starting from 3pm.


Students’ well-being is our priority. Hence during post-season and end-of-year examination period, CCA sessions will be scaled down.


Please refer to our CCA schedule for more details on the training days and duration.

questionListItems.title: Can my child take up more than one CCA other than her DSA sport?

answer.body: DSA students are obliged to commit and perform well in their DSA sport. In addition to the school’s CCA training (three times per week), most DSA students also train with their private coaches or with the national youth team. They are strongly advised to focus on one CCA so that they have sufficient time to cope with the demands of their DSA CCA and the rigour of the academics.

questionListItems.title: We are Singapore Citizens and are currently residing overseas. We are planning to return to Singapore for summer break. Could my child/ward attend an immersion in MGS for 2 weeks?

answer.body: For immersion programme to MGS secondary school, please write to our Vice-Principal, Mrs Corinne Sim or Senior Executive, Ms Ho Wai Fun for more information.

questionListItems.title: My family is planning to go overseas to work or related concerns. How can we reserve the current place in MGS?

answer.body: You may request for Leave of Absence (LOA) during the posting period. You will need to get ready the official posting letter in order to complete the application.

questionListItems.title: My family is holding employment & dependent passes. Can we enrol our child/ward to MGS?

answer.body: All International Students (IS) seeking admission into mainstream schools are required to participate in the Admissions Exercise for International Students (AEIS). For more information, please visit the MOE website.

questionListItems.title: How do I apply for mid-stream transfer into MGS?

answer.body:
For primary school, click here.

For secondary school, click here.

questionListItems.title: How do I appeal to MGS for admissions into Secondary 1?

answer.body:
Secondary 1 Appeal Exercise is conducted for all PSLE candidates after the release of the S1 Posting results. You may find the details on the application process after the release of the S1 Posting.

Any applicant’s PSLE score should be within the school cut-off scores. We regret that we are unable to consider any appeals who do not meet the cut-off.
